description: From suburb +â€Ž -ia (suffix forming abstract nouns, the names of collections of things, etc.)

entries.meaning: (originally Britain) The suburbs as a whole and all that characterizes or pertains to them; (sometimes derogatory) the suburbs as encapsulated or represented by the typical characteristics or qualities of the people living there, especially complacency, conformity, conservativeness, dullness, etc. [from late 19th c.]
